intro: Navarretia virgata var. dasyantha, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. This variety is part of the Polemoniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
